bio:treatment.description: Biennials or perennials (rarely flowering first year), (15–)25–40(–50+) cm. Stems arachno-villous (gray to gray-green). Heads in ± loose to crowded, corymbiform arrays. Peduncles (5–)10–25 mm. Involucres 5–6 mm. Rays (2–)3(–4); laminae 4–6+ mm, spreading in fruit. Disc florets 5–9(–12). Cypselae villous; pappi of 4–5 lance-subulate scales 2–2.5 mm (scales ± villous abaxially and margins ± lacerate). 2n = 32.
Creosote-bush scrub, desert flats, dry banks, limestone soils;
Tex.; Mexico (Coahuila, Durango, Nuevo León, San Luis Potosí, Tamaulipas, Zacatecas).
